metadata.case_name: C. K. Doraiswamy Naidu v. The State of Andhra Pradesh

facts.text: Appellant passed M.B.B.S. examination of Madras University in 1940 and entered service of State of Madras on August 14, 1941 as Civil Assistant Surgeon.
On formation of State of Andhra Pradesh, appellant's services allotted to new State.
In 1961, appellant working as Officer-in-charge of Vijaywada Government Headquarters Hospital.

Government of Andhra Pradesh referred case to Tribunal under Andhra Pradesh Civil Services Disciplinary Proceedings Tribunal Act 1960; Tribunal framed number of charges on August 22, 1962 by Chairman Shri Umpathy Rao.
Proceedings first conducted before Shri Umpathy Rao; Tribunal consisted of two members.
On or about January 7, 1963, case transferred to Shri Nazimuddin; appellant protested bias, case withdrawn.
Shri K. Umpathy Rao continued enquiry until March 21, 1963 and examined certain witnesses.
On March 21, 1963, case transferred to Shri Shankar Pershad who succeeded Shri Nazimuddin.
Shri Shankar Pershad held inquiry until June 20, 1963 and examined a number of witnesses; retired in July 1963.

Shri G. Ramaiah Chowdhary succeeded Shri Shankar Pershad, continued enquiry, examined some witnesses, heard arguments on October 26, 1963 after written statement filed and appellant's witnesses examined.
Shri Chowdhary transferred on February 2, 1964; succeeded by Shri C. Jaganathacharyulu (Chairman).
Shri C. Jaganathacharyulu submitted report on July 31, 1964 holding 10 out of 22 charges proved.
On September 15, 1964, notice sent to appellant by first respondent to show cause why he should not be dismissed from service.
On September 3, 1964, first respondent directed penalty of dismissal imposed on appellant.
Appellant filed writ petition in Andhra Pradesh High Court under Art. 226 challenging dismissal order principally on ground that Tribunal proceedings vitiated.
While writ pending, Division Bench of High Court on September 7, 1965 held under identical provisions of Hyderabad Public Service Tribunal Enquiry Act that single member report invalid.
Amendment to S.7 by adding proviso via Act 27 of 1965.
High Court dismissed writ petition on July 5, 1956? (noted as 1956 but context 1965/67), relying on proviso to S.7.
Sub-rule 6 of Rule 7 added by G.O.Ms. No. 690 dated June 12, 1964.
Shri Venkata Rao (successor) heard arguments on 9th and 10th July 1964; never examined witnesses.

legal_issues.text: Whether the Tribunal proceedings were vitiated due to multiple transfers and final report by single member Shri Venkata Rao who only heard arguments, and whether proviso to S.7 deems his report as Tribunal's report.
Whether hearing arguments constitutes part of 'inquiry' under S.6(1) for purpose of proviso to S.7.

petitioner_arguments.text: Proceedings before Tribunal vitiated from beginning to end due to multiple transfers and single member conducting inquiry.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Andhra Pradesh Civil Services Disciplinary Proceedings Tribunal Act 1960, Ss.3,6,7

petitioner_arguments.text: Amendment to S.7 proviso does not validate report as single member (Venkata Rao) did not hold inquiry, only heard arguments.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Proviso to S.7; Division Bench decision Sept 7, 1965

respondent_arguments.text: Report valid under proviso to S.7 as Shri Venkata Rao held inquiry per S.6(1) by dealing with predecessor's evidence per Rule 7(6) and hearing arguments.

court_reasoning.text: Manner of proceedings extraordinary with frequent transfers preventing conclusion by inquiring member.
Under S.6(1), inquiry by single member as Chairman directs; S.7 requires Tribunal to report findings; proviso allows single member's report if he held inquiry.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Proviso requires single member to have held the inquiry himself.

court_reasoning.text: Hearing arguments not part of 'enquiry'; enquiry completes before arguments per Rule 7(1)(iii); Venkata Rao only heard arguments, no evidence taken.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Arguments would not be a part of enquiry.

court_reasoning.text: Rule 7(6) cannot override S.7; where single member held no enquiry, all members must report.
court_reasoning.key_observation: His report could not be deemed to be the report of the Tribunal.

holdings.text: Report of Shri Venkata Rao does not satisfy proviso to S.7 as he did not hold any part of the enquiry; order of dismissal illegal and void.
Enquiry does not include hearing arguments or recording findings; completes upon completing record/evidence.

precedents_cited.case_name: Division Bench decision of Andhra Pradesh High Court (unnamed, on Hyderabad Public Service Tribunal Enquiry Act)
precedents_cited.relevance: Held single member report invalid if not all members apply mind; prompted amendment.

precedents_cited.case_name: C. K. Doraiswamy Naidu v. The State of Andhra Pradesh

statutes_cited.name: Andhra Pradesh Civil Services (Disciplinary Proceedings) Tribunal Act, 1960
statutes_cited.relevance: Governs Tribunal constitution, inquiry procedure, reporting findings; proviso to S.7 key to validity.

statutes_cited.name: Andhra Pradesh Civil Services (Disciplinary Proceedings) Tribunal Amendment Act, 1965 (Act 27 of 1965)
statutes_cited.relevance: Added proviso validating single member reports where he held inquiry.

statutes_cited.name: Constitution of India
statutes_cited.relevance: Basis for writ petition challenging dismissal.

statutes_cited.name: Rules under Section 10 of the Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Procedure for inquiry, report, show cause; Rule 7(6) on successor handling predecessor's evidence.

outcome.summary: Appeal allowed, High Court order set aside; order of dismissal held illegal and void as Tribunal report invalid under S.7 proviso.

key_quotes.text: "the manner in which the proceedings were conducted before the Tribunal strikes us as most extraordinary."
key_quotes.speaker: court

key_quotes.text: "As Shri Venkata Rao had only heard arguments and had not held any part of the enquiry, his report could not be deemed to be the report of the Tribunal under the proviso to s. 7 of the Act."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Core holding on invalidity of report.

key_quotes.text: "arguments would not be a part of enquiry."
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Defines scope of 'enquiry' under the Act.
